Pennsylvania and West Virginia show largest increases in natural gas proved reserves mp3
Date: December 4, 2014
Description: U.S. natural gas proved reserves have hit an all-time high....with Pennsylvania and West Virginia accounting for 70% of the increase ....according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/reserve_report_gas_12042014.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:15
Size of mp3: 1.1 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/naturalgas/crudeoilreserves/
North Dakota and Texas help boost U.S. oil reserves to highest level since 1975 mp3
Date: December 4, 2014
Description: U.S. proved oil reserves have topped 36 billion barrels for the first time in nearly four decades....with North Dakota and Texas accounting for 90% of the increase according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/oil_reserve_12042014.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:29
Size of mp3: 1.4 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/naturalgas/crudeoilreserves/

Date: December 4, 2014
Description: U.S. proved oil reserves have topped 36 billion barrels for the first time in nearly four decades, while natural gas proved reserves climbed to a new record.

Date: November 24, 2014
Description: The U.S. average retail price for on-highway diesel fuel fell to $3.63 a gallon on Monday. That's down 3.3 cents from a week ago, based on the weekly price survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration. Diesel prices were highest in the Mid-west region at 3.74 a gallon, down 4.3 cents from a week ago. Prices were lowest in the Lower Atlantic states at 3.44 a gallon, down 2.8 cents.

U.S. crude oil production expected to top 9 million barrels per day in December mp3
Date: November 12, 2014
Description: U.S. crude oil production is expected to continue to increase through next year, despite the outlook for lower crude oil prices. In its new short-term forecast, the U.S. Energy Information Administration said monthly average oil production is on track to surpass 9 million barrels per day in December for the first time since 1986 and then rise to an average 9.4 million barrels a day next year.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo_crude_oil_production_11122014.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:58
Size of mp3: 0.9 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
U.S. gasoline price expected to drop further below $3 per gallon mp3
Date: November 12, 2014
Description: The national average pump price of gasoline dropped below $3 per gallon last week for the first time in nearly four years.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo_gasoline_prices_11122014.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:01
Size of mp3: 0.9 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
Lower oil prices also cutting winter heating oil and propane bills mp3
Date: November 12, 2014
Description: Lower oil prices are not only driving down gasoline costs, but U.S. consumers will also see a bigger savings in their heating oil and propane bills this winter.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo_heating_bills_11122014.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:58
Size of mp3: 0.9 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
U.S. Diesel Fuel Price Increases for First Time Since June mp3
Date: November 10, 2014
Description: The U.S. average retail price for on-highway diesel fuel rose to $3.68 a gallon on Monday. That's up 5.4 cents from a week ago and marks the first increase since late June, based on the weekly price survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration. Diesel prices were highest in the Rocky Mountain states at 3.80 a gallon, up 8.3 cents from a week ago. Prices were lowest in the Lower Atlantic states at 3.50 a gallon, down 3.6 cents.
Contact/Author: Amerine Woodyard, 202-586-1256
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/diesel_price_11102014.pdf

Date: November 10, 2014
Description: The U.S. average retail price for regular gasoline fell to $2.94 a gallon on Monday. U.S. gasoline prices decrease (long version) mp3
Date: July 7, 2014
Description: The U.S. average retail price for regular gasoline fell to $3.68 a gallon on Monday. That's down 2.6 cents from a week ago, based on the weekly price survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration. Pump prices were highest in the West Coast states at 4.04 a gallon, up a tenth of a penny from a week ago. Prices were lowest in the Gulf Coast region at 3.46 a gallon, down 2.1 cents.

Description: The U.S. average retail price for regular gasoline fell to $3.67 a gallon on Monday. That's down 3-tenths of a penny from a week ago, based on the weekly price survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Amerine Woodyard, 202-586-1256
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/gasoline_prices_05192014_short.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:17
Size of mp3: 0.3 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/petroleum/gasdiesel/

U.S. summer gasoline price higher due to rising crude oil costs mp3
Date: May 6, 2014
Description: The price U.S. drivers pay for gasoline this summer is expected to average $3.61 per gallon, that's 3 cents more than last summer.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719

Size of mp3: 0.5 mb

U.S. monthly crude oil production highest in 26 years with bigger oil flows still to come mp3
Date: May 6, 2014
Description: U.S. crude oil production averaged 8.3 million barrels per day in April the highest monthly level in 26 years and output is expected to keep growing.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo_crude_oil_production_05062014.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:06
Size of mp3: 0.5 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
Natural gas injections into storage off to slow start, but record refill season still expected mp3
Date: May 6, 2014
Description: The amount of U.S. natural gas being injected into underground storage has gotten off to a slow start after this winter's very cold weather depleted much of the supply but a record amount of gas is still expected to flow into storage by the start of the next heating season in the fall.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo_natural_gas_storage_05062014.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:59
Size of mp3: 0.5 mb

Residential heating oil price decreases mp3
Date: March 19, 2014
Description: The average retail price for home heating oil fell 7.2 cents from a week ago to $4.12 per gallon. That's up 9.4 cents from a year ago, based on the residential heating fuel survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration. Heating oil prices in the New England region fell to 4.07 per gallon, down 6.3 cents from last week, and up 9.4 cents from a year ago.
Contact/Author: Marcela Rourk, 202-586-4412
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/heating_oil_prices_03192014.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:29
Size of mp3: 0.5 mb

Residential propane price decreases mp3
Date: March 19, 2014
Description: The average retail price for propane fell to $3.08 per gallon, down 8.6 cents from a week ago, based on the residential heating fuel survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration. Propane prices in the Midwest region averaged 2.48 a gallon, down 10.7 cents from last week, but up 69.7 cents from a year ago.

U.S. natural gas stocks at the end of the heating season expected to be lowest since 2003 mp3
Date: March 11, 2014
Description: In its new monthly forecast, the U.S. Energy Information Administration expects the amount of natural gas in storage to fall to below 1 trillion cubic feet by the end of the March. That's the lowest level for inventories at the close of the heating season since 2003.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo_natural_gas_inventories_03112014.pdf

Snow and cold cut into U.S. crude oil production this winter mp3
Date: March 11, 2014
Description: This winter's harsh weather conditions temporarily slowed U.S. crude oil production. In its new forecast, the U.S. Energy Information Administration said oil production in the Bakken formation in North Dakota and Montana hit 1 million barrels per day last November.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo_crude_oil_production_03112014.pdf

Date: March 11, 2014
Description: Nonindustrialized countries are expected to account for all of the growth in global petroleum demand this year and for most of the increase in 2015.

Date: January 3, 2014
Description: The average retail price for propane rose 3.9 cents from a week ago to $2.80 per gallon. That's up 53.7 cents from a year ago, based on the residential heating fuel survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration. Propane prices in the Midwest region averaged 2.32 a gallon, up 3.8 cents from last week, and up 59.3 cents from a year ago.

Description: U.S. gasoline prices are expected to fall as more oil refineries come back on line and crude oil prices decline.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719

Rising U.S. oil output leads world oil supply growth mp3
Date: July 9, 2013
Description: U.S. crude oil production reached 7 million barrels per day at the end of 2012 for the first time in two decades and is well on its way to topping 8 million barrels per day by 2014.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo_crude_oil_production_07092013.pdf

Size of mp3: 0.5 mb

Gasoline prices fall slightly (long version) mp3
Date: July 8, 2013
Description: The U.S. average retail price for regular gasoline fell slightly to $3.49 a gallon on Monday. That's down 4-tenths of a penny from a week ago, based on the weekly price survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Amerine Woodyard, 202-586-1256

Active hurricane season expected to shut-in higher amount of oil and natural gas production mp3
Date: June 11, 2013
Description: An above-normal 2013 hurricane season is expected to cause a median production loss of about 19 million barrels of U.S. crude oil and 46 billion cubic feet of natural gas production in the Gulf of Mexico, according to the new forecast from the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719

Description: The U.S. average retail price for regular gasoline showed little movement from last week. Prices remained flat at $3.30 a gallon on Monday, based on the weekly price survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Amerine Woodyard, 202-586-1256
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/gasoline_price_01072013_long.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:31
Size of mp3: 0.5 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/petroleum/gasdiesel/
Gasoline prices flat this week (short version) mp3
Date: January 7, 2013
Description: The U.S. average retail price for regular gasoline showed little movement from last week. Prices remained flat at $3.30 a gallon on Monday, based on the weekly price survey by the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Amerine Woodyard, 202-586-1256

Size of mp3: 0.3 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/petroleum/gasdiesel/
Rise in 2012 U.S. oil production largest since 1859, output in 2013 seen topping 7 million bpd mp3
Date: December 11, 2012
Description: U.S. crude oil production is now expected to rise by about 760,000 barrels per day in 2012, the biggest annual increase in oil output since U.S. commercial crude oil production began in 1859. U.S. crude oil production next year is expected to top 7 million barrels per day for the first time since 1992.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo-oil-production-12112012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:49
Size of mp3: 0.8 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
Rise in 2012 U.S. oil production largest since 1859, output in 2013 seen topping 7 million bpd mp3
Date: December 11, 2012
Description: U.S. crude oil production is now expected to rise by about 760,000 barrels per day in 2012, the biggest annual increase in oil output since U.S. commercial crude oil production began in 1859. U.S. crude oil production next year is expected to top 7 million barrels per day for the first time since 1992.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719

Length of mp3: 00:00:49
Size of mp3: 0.8 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
U.S. coal demand seen below 1 billion tons in 2012 for fourth year in a row mp3
Date: December 11, 2012
Description: Coal consumption by U.S. power plants to generate electricity is expected to fall below 1 billion tons in 2012 for the fourth year in a row. Domestic coal consumption is on track to total 829 million tons this year. That's the lowest level since 1992, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration's new monthly energy forecast.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo-coal-12112012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:56
Size of mp3: 0.9 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
U.S. 2012 natural gas production seen at record 69 billion cubic feet per day mp3
Date: December 11, 2012
Description: U.S. natural gas production is expected to increase 4.5 percent this year to a record 69 billion cubic feet per day, according to the new monthly energy forecast from the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo-natural-gas-12112012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:47
Size of mp3: 0.7 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
U.S. expected to become net exporter of natural gas by end of decade mp3
Date: December 5, 2012
Description: The United States is on track to become a net exporter of natural gas by 2020 as domestic gas production continues to increase faster than consumption through this decade.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/aeo-lng-12052012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:03
Size of mp3: 1.0 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/aeo/er/
Renewables account for a bigger share of U.S. electricity generation in decades ahead mp3
Date: December 5, 2012
Description: The United States will generate a bigger share of its electricity from renewable sources such as solar, wind, and biomass energy in the decades ahead, according to the new long-term outlook just released by the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/aeo-renewable-12052012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:04
Size of mp3: 1.0 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/aeo/er
Growing U.S. oil output and rising vehicle fuel economy to cut U.S. reliance on foreign oil mp3
Date: December 5, 2012
Description: The United States is expected to continue cutting its dependence on petroleum and liquid fuels imports over the rest of this decade because of growing domestic crude oil production and more fuel-efficient vehicles on America's highways.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/aeo-oil-120512.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:12
Size of mp3: 1.0 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/aeo/er/
U.S. drivers to pull up to lower prices at the gasoline pump in the fourth quarter mp3
Date: November 6, 2012
Description: U.S. drivers should see lower gasoline prices in the fourth quarter of this year. The national pump price is expected to average $3.56 per gallon during the period said the U.S. Energy Information Administration in its new monthly short-term energy outlook. That's down 4 cents from what the agency projected in last month's forecast.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo-gas-prices-11062012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:12
Size of mp3: 1.0 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
Despite drop in domestic coal production, U.S. coal exports to reach record high in 2012. mp3
Date: November 6, 2012
Description: While U.S. coal production is down 7 percent this year due in part to utilities switching to low-priced natural gas to generate electricity, American coal is still finding plenty of buyers in overseas markets.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo-coal-supplies-11062012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:45
Size of mp3: 0.8 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
U.S. natural gas supplies plentiful to help meet higher demand this winter mp3
Date: November 6, 2012
Description: The amount of U.S. natural gas in underground storage reached an estimated 3.9 trillion cubic feet at the end of October. That's up 3 percent from the same time last year and a record high says the U.S. Energy Information Administration in its new monthly short-term energy outlook.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/steo-ng-supplies-11062012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:48
Size of mp3: 0.8 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
Last year's warm U.S. winter temperatures to give way to normal, increasing household heating fuel use mp3
Date: October 10, 2012
Description: Average household demand for natural gas, the most common primary heating fuel, is expected to be up 14 percent this winter. Demand for electricity will be up 8 percent. Demand for heating oil is and propane are each expected to be 17 percent higher.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/fuel-use-steo10102012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:45
Size of mp3: 0.9 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
Natural gas, propane, and electricity supplies seen plentiful this winter for U.S. home heating mp3
Date: October 10, 2012
Description: Supplies of the major heating fuels used by most U.S. households are expected to be plentiful this winter, with the possible exception of heating oil, which is consumed mostly by households in the Northeast.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/fuel-supplies-steo10102012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:01:06
Size of mp3: 1.0 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
More U.S. households burning wood this winter to stay warm, reversing two-decade decline mp3
Date: October 10, 2012
Description: Burning wood as the primary heating source in U.S. households has risen over the last 10 years, reversing the decline seen in the 1980s and 1990s. About 2.6 million households out of 115 million will rely on wood as the main way to warm their homes this winter.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/wood-steo10102012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:46
Size of mp3: 0.7 mb
More on this topic: http://www.eia.gov/forecasts/steo/report/
U.S. oil production forecast to rise almost 700,000 bpd this year, help cut U.S. petroleum imports mp3
Date: September 11, 2012
Description: U.S. crude oil production is expected to average 6.3 million barrels per day in 2012 and the share of U.S. petroleum consumption that will be met by imports is expected to decline to 41 percent.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719
Transcript: http://www.eia.gov/radio/transcript/oil-steo09112012.pdf
Length of mp3: 00:00:58
Size of mp3: 0.9 mb

U.S. natural gas production at record high, inventories most ever at start of heating season on Nov. 1 mp3
Date: September 11, 2012
Description: U.S. natural gas production is expected to rise this year to a record 68.9 billion cubic feet per day and U.S. gas inventories are expected to reach a record high of nearly 4 trillion cubic feet at the start of the U.S. natural gas heating season on November 1st.
Contact/Author: Jonathan Cogan, 202-586-8719

EIA's radio service will provide free short broadcast stories on EIA energy data reports and analysis to radio stations nationwide
